title: AEME Inputs
text: Inputs AEME designed similar standard data inputs used lake ecosystem modelling.

title: AEME Inputs
AEME Inputs
text: Meteorological data requirements lake modelling similar used lake ecosystem models. following meteorological variables required AEME: Air temperature Shortwave radiation Wind speed Rain Either relative humidity dew point temperature Either mean sea level pressure station pressure following meteorological variables can derived required variables: Dew point temperature Relative humidity Precipitation vapor pressure Wind u v components Cloud cover Longwave radiation

title: AEME Inputs
text: able specify parameters model crucial simulation. Parameters can stored data frame within aeme object. parameters data frame used update model configuration files /update meteorological data (e.g. scaling wind factor) /update inflow/outflow data (e.g. scaling inflow factor).

title: Introduction to AEME
text: AEME package hosts three one-dimensional hydrodynamic models: DYnamic REservoir Simulation Model (DYRESM), General Lake Model (GLM), General Ocean Turbulence Model (GOTM, adapted closed basins application lakes reservoirs). models can coupled corresponding water quality models, DYRESM-CAEDYM (Computational Aquatic Ecosystem Dynamics Model), GLM-AED2 (Aquatic Ecosystem Dynamics Model 2), GOTM-WET (Water Ecosystem Tool). Key aspects AEME package include: Defined S4 class aeme objects Configuration models common standardised inputs Standardised calibration, manipulation visualisation

title: Introduction to AEME
text: aeme object main object AEME package. S4 class contains information required run model. aeme object contains following slots: lake - list object containing information lake (name, id, latitude, longitude, elevation, depth, area) time - list object containing information time (start, stop, spin_up, time_step) configuration - list object containing information configuration (model_controls, dy_cd, glm_aed, gotm_wet) observations - list object containing information observations (lake, level) inputs - list object containing information inputs (init_profile, init_depth, hypsograph, meteo, use_lw, Kw) inflows - list object containing information inflows (data, factor) outflows - list object containing information outflows (data, outflow_lvl, factor) water_balance - list object containing information water balance configuration (use, method, data) parameters - data.frame describing parameters input column names (model, file, name, value, min, max, module, group) output - list object containing information outputs (n_members)

title: Introduction to AEME
text: lake slot contains information lake. list object contains following objects: name - Name lake (character). id - Lake ID (character numeric). latitude - Latitude lake (numeric). provided, latitude calculated centroid shape. longitude - Longitude lake (numeric). provided, longitude calculated centroid shape. elevation - Elevation lake (numeric). shape - Shape lake (sf object). shape lake can represented polygon. centroid polygon used calculate latitude longitude lake. depth - Max depth lake (m) (numeric). Depth area used generate simple hypsographic curve none provided inputs slot. area - Surface area lake (m2) (numeric) Objects bold required building running model.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: time slot contains information time. list object contains following objects: start - Start date simulation (character). start date must format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. end - End date simulation (character). end date must format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. timestep - Timestep simulation (numeric). timestep must seconds. spin_up - List spin periods simulation model (numeric). spin period must days. spin period period time model run simulation period. spin period used initialise model discarded examining simulation period.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: configuration slot list contains model configurations. includes configurations files hydrodynamic components well aquatic ecosystem model components: Files hydrodynamic ecosystem models. build_aeme() ran, model_controls data.frame passed function argument added configuration slot. details model_controls, see ’s section .

title: Introduction to AEME
text: observations slot list contains observations -lake (lake) variables (e.g. water temperature, chlorophyll-, dissolved oxygen etc.) water level (level). observations used assess model performance using function also calibrate model using aemetools package. lake observations stored data frame following columns: Date - Date observation (character). date must format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. depth - Depth observation (m) (numeric). depth must metres. var - Variable name observation (character). variable names input preparation designed AEME inputs article. value - Value observation (numeric). level observations stored data frame following columns: Date - Date observation (character). date must format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. value - Value observation (numeric).

title: Introduction to AEME
text: input slot list contains following objects: init_profile - profile initialise lake simulation (data.frame). columns: “depth”, “temperature” “salt”. provided, automatically generated using values model_controls. init_depth - depth lake initialising model (vector), provided, assume depth hypsograph. hypsograph - lake hypsograph. data.frame columns “elev”, “depth” “area”. data, can generate one using generate_hypsograph() function. meteo - meteorological data. data.frame minimum must contain columns date (“Date”), air temperature (“MET_tmpair), wind speed (”MET_wndspd”) shortwave radiation (“MET_radswd”). See AEME Inputs use_lw - Logical switch use longwave radiation. Defaults TRUE. Kw - light extinction coefficient (m−1m^{-1}).

title: Introduction to AEME
text: inflows slot list contains following objects: data - named list data.frames contain columns date (“Date”), flow (“HYD_flow”; m3day−1m^3 day^{-1}). Temperature can also provided (“HYD_temp”), however provided estimated using air temperature. name list used stream identifier model. method water_balance section set to3, “wbal” added data, contains separate inflow model, estimated using different evaporation functions inside model. factor - list scaling factors applied inflows. Named according model. inflows present slot empty.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: outflows slot list contains following objects: data - named list data.frames contain columns date (“Date”), flow (“HYD_flow”; m3day−1m^3 day^{-1}). method water_balance section set 2 3, “wbal” added data, contains separate outflow model, estimated using different evaporation functions inside model. factor - list scaling factors applied outflows. Named according model. However, can also passed parameter model_parameters section calibrated . preferred method applying scaling factors. outflows present slot empty.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: water balance slot generated internally build_aeme() function called wb_method set 2 3. slot contains: use: define lake level use. Can either observed (“obs”) modelled (“mod”) lake level. Default = “obs”. method: can 1 (inflows outflows) 2 (outflows calculated) 3 (inflows outflows calculated). default 2 . data: list two data.frames. “wbal” contains diagnostics estimating evaporation water balance model “model” contains modelled lake water level use “mod”.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: parameters slot contains data.frame parameters used building model. update default model parameters scale meteorological scale inflows outflows model. columns parameters data.frame : model - Either “dy_cd”, “glm_aed” “gotm_wet”. file - Either name file e.g. “glm3.nml” model specific files “met” meteorological variables “inf” inflow “wdr” outflows. (Outflows initiallly referred withdrawals, hence “wdr” notation, probably updated reflect current outflows slot soon…). name - Name parameter. name parameter nested nml/yaml file, whole hierarchy needs provide level separated “/” e.g. “light/Kw” Kw GLM-AED. value - Value parameter. min - Minimum range parameter. used aemetools::calib_aeme() aemetools::sa_aeme() function. max - Maximum range parameter. used aemetools::calib_aeme() aemetools::sa_aeme() function. module - Module parameter . necessary, helpful identifying parameters module GLM-AED GOTM-WET. group - Phytoplankton group. used GOTM-WET phytoplankton parameters. function get_aeme_parameters() allows select parameters based model module. See ?get_aeme_parameters() details.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: output slot list updated run_aeme() executed. time executed, variable outputs designated model_controls added Aeme object.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: model_controls data.frame generated get_model_controls(). data.frame columns: var_aeme - character; AEME variable name simulate - logical; add variable Aeme object inf_default - numeric; default value use inflows none present inflows. particularly important configuring water chemistry inflows use_bgc = TRUE. initial_wc - numeric; value use initialising model. automatically updated variable present observations slot. initial_sed - numeric; value use intialising sediment module DYRESM-CAEDYM model. conversion_aed - numeric; factor multiply convert GLM-AED units. model built mode

title: Introduction to AEME
text: aeme object can created using aeme_constructor() function. requires basic inputs YAML file using yaml_to_aeme function. YAML file contains information required run model.
code: # Define lake list lat <- -36.88921 lon <- 174.4669 depth <- 13.08 area <- 153648  lake <- list(     latitude = lat,     longitude = lon,     # elevation = elevation,     depth = depth,     area = area   ) time <- list(   start = as.POSIXct("2020-07-01"),   stop = as.POSIXct("2022-06-30") )  hypsograph <- generate_hypsograph(max_depth = depth, surface_area = area,                                   volume_development = 1.2)  met <- aemetools::get_era5_land_point_nz(lat = lat, lon = lon,                                          years = 2020:2022)  #' Define input list input = list(   hypsograph = hypsograph,   meteo = met,   Kw = 1.21 )  aeme <- aeme_constructor(lake = lake, time = time, input = input) slotNames(aeme) #>  [1] "lake"          "time"          "configuration" "observations"  #>  [5] "input"         "inflows"       "outflows"      "water_balance" #>  [9] "output"        "parameters"

title: Introduction to AEME
text: aeme object can manipulated using AEME package functions. functions defined slot names aeme object. example, lake slot can manipulated using lake function.

title: Introduction to AEME

title: Using LERNZmp with AEME
text: Lake Ecosystem Research New Zealand Model Platform (LERNZmp) web platform provides user-friendly interface lake ecosystem model output New Zealand lakes. platform designed provide simple way explore model output across multiple lakes also compare model results observed data. platform located : LERNZmp. Select load lake model output “Overview” tab. model output can downloaded “Download Models” tab. downloads “.zip” folder containing model output selected lake(s) “.rds” files lake metadata file “LERNZmp_lake_metadata.csv”.

title: Using LERNZmp with AEME
text: downloaded LERNZmp model output unzipped folder, similar file structure following:

title: Using LERNZmp with AEME
text: Aeme object contains input data models. includes lake metadata, model controls, model configuration. input slot contains initial profile (“init_profile”), initial depth (“init_depth”), hypograph (“hypograph”), meteorological data (“meteo”), switch using longwave radiation (“use_lw”) light extinction coefficient (“Kw”) models.

title: Set up AEME for a new lake
text: first step define lake data. includes location lake, depth area lake, elevation lake.
code: # Define the location of the lake lat <- -36.8898 lon <- 174.46898 # View the location of the lake in a map  coords <- data.frame(lat = lat, lon = lon) |>    st_as_sf(coords = c("lon", "lat"), crs = 4326)  tm_shape(coords) +   tm_bubbles() +   tm_view(set_view = c(lon, lat, 16))

title: Set up AEME for a new lake
text: shapefile lake, can use sf package read . However, shapefile can download lake shapefiles OpenStreetMap using osmdata package. Visualise lake shapefile map. can see matches location lake defined earlier perfectly matches outline OpenStreetMap polygon.
code: library(osmdata) #> Data (c) OpenStreetMap contributors, ODbL 1.0. https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright  # Get lake shapefile osm_data <- opq(bbox = "New Zealand") |>    add_osm_feature(key = "name", value = "Lake Wainamu") |>    osmdata_sf()  # Extract lake polygon lake <- osm_data$osm_multipolygons |>    st_make_valid() lake #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 8 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 174.4645 ymin: -36.89192 xmax: 174.4756 ymax: -36.88651 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>            osm_id         name name:mi natural ref:linz:place_id         type #> 16007084 16007084 Lake Wainamu Wainamu   water             26277 multipolygon #>           wikidata       wikipedia                       geometry #> 16007084 Q85173632 en:Lake Wainamu POLYGON ((174.4665 -36.8869... # View the lake shapefile tm_shape(lake) +   tm_borders(lwd = 2)

title: Set up AEME for a new lake
text: depth area lake required model. can obtained variety sources. example, use known depth lake (13.07 m), however area calculate shapefile.
code: # Set depth & area depth <- 13.07 # Depth of the lake in metres # Calculate the area of the lake in m2 area <- st_area(lake) |>    units::set_units("m^2") |>    as.numeric() area #> [1] 156875.6

title: Set up AEME for a new lake
text: Elevation data can acquired New Zealand digital elevation model hosted LINZ Data Service. wrapper function aemetools package. requires API key LINZ. can easily create key LINZ website: https://data.linz.govt.nz/ use function within aemetools package create one. adding .Renviron file. get_dem_value function return elevation lake metres sea level. now create list lake data. used construct AEME object.
code: aemetools::create_linz_key() # Add the LINZ API key to your .Renviron file aemetools::add_linz_key(key = "your_key_here") # Get the elevation of the lake key <- Sys.getenv("LINZ_KEY") elevation <- aemetools::get_dem_value(lat = lat, lon = lon, key = key) #> Warning: replacing previous import 'AEME::time' by 'terra::time' when loading #> 'aemetools' elevation # in metres above sea level #> [1] 29 elevation #> [1] 29 # Define lake list lake = list(     name = "Wainamu",     id = 45819,     latitude = lat,     longitude = lon,     elevation = elevation,     depth = depth,     area = area   )

title: Set up AEME for a new lake
text: hypsograph data lake, can use input model. critical input model, defines relationship lake area lake elevation. However, hypsograph data, model use simple cone-shaped hypsograph based lake depth area. ideal, work example. Required column names hypsograph data area, elev, depth.  can see, hypsograph simple cone shape. Ideally, detailed hypsograph data lake. information regarding maximum depth lake, surface area estimate volume development, can generate hypsograph using generate_hypsograph function. volume_development parameter scaling factor volume development lake. Values 1.5 lakes concave hypsograph, values 1.5 lakes convex hypsograph, values 1.5 lakes linear hypsograph. Wainamu Lake, use volume development 1.62 calculated bathymetry survey lake. can view LERNZmp platform.
code: # Generate a simple hypsograph hypsograph_simple <- data.frame(area = c(area, 0),                           elev = c(elevation, elevation - depth),                          depth = c(0, -depth)) hypsograph_simple #>       area  elev  depth #> 1 156875.6 29.00   0.00 #> 2      0.0 15.93 -13.07 # Plot the hypsograph library(ggplot2)  ggplot(hypsograph_simple, aes(x = area, y = elev)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   xlab("Area (m2)") +   ylab("Elevation (m)") +   theme_bw() # Generate a hypsograph hypsograph <- generate_hypsograph(max_depth = depth, surface_area = area,                                   volume_development = 0.5, elev = elevation,                                   ext_elev = 1)  ggplot(hypsograph, aes(x = area, y = elev)) +   geom_line() +   geom_point() +   geom_line(data = hypsograph_simple, aes(x = area, y = elev),              linetype = "dashed") +   xlab("Area (m2)") +   ylab("Elevation (m)") +   theme_bw() # Define input list input = list(     init_depth = depth,     hypsograph = hypsograph,     meteo = met,     use_lw = TRUE,     Kw = Kw   )

text: build_aeme function take AEME object model controls build ensemble. model argument character vector models include ensemble. models available dy_cd, glm_aed, gotm_wet. default, build_aeme function build file configuration model. create necessary files model run. files also stored aeme object configuration slot list hydrodynamic ecosystem model configurations. information data needed run ensemble models now contained within aeme object. allows easy storage data also easy sharing data others. Sharing aeme object others allows run ensemble models without needing reconstruct object.
code: # Select models model <- c("dy_cd", "glm_aed", "gotm_wet") # Path for model directory path <- "aeme"  # Build ensemble aeme <- build_aeme(aeme = aeme, model = model, model_controls = model_controls,                     use_bgc = F, path = path) #> Building simulation for Wainamu [2025-09-30 22:17:52] #> No water level present. Using constant water level. #> Estimating temperature using Stefan & Preud'homme (2007)... #> Correcting water balance using estimated outflows (method = 2). #> Calculating lake level using lake depth and a sinisoidal function. #> Building DYRESM-CAEDYM for lake wainamu #> Copied in DYRESM par file #> Writing DYRESM configuration #> Writing DYRESM control file #> Building GLM3-AED2 model for lake wainamu #> Copied in GLM nml file #> Building GOTM-WET for lake wainamu #> Copied all GOTM configuration files  print(aeme) #>             AEME  #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Lake #> Wainamu (ID: 45819); title: AEME - Aquatic Ecosytem Model Ensemble
text: basic example shows build run one models ensemble: model input output handled ’s S4 object class aeme. allows standardisation generalisation functions class alongside ensuring integrity validity ’s structure. allows easier handling model output data within structure allows condensed output printed console: Model data can visualised easily using plot_output() function:  Also, visualising lake level plots.
code: library(AEME) ## basic example code tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") aeme <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml") model_controls <- get_model_controls(use_bgc = TRUE) model <- c("dy_cd", "glm_aed", "gotm_wet") aeme <- build_aeme(path = path, aeme = aeme, model = model,                             model_controls = model_controls,                             ext_elev = 5, use_bgc = TRUE) aeme <- run_aeme(aeme = aeme, model = model, verbose = FALSE,                        path = path, parallel = TRUE) class(aeme) #> [1] "Aeme" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "AEME" aeme #>             AEME  #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Lake #> Wainamu (ID: 45819); Lat: -36.89; Lon: 174.47; Elev: 23.64m; Depth: 13.07m; #> Area: 152343 m2; Shape file: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Time #> Start: 2020-08-01; Stop: 2021-06-30; Time step: 3600 #>  Spin up (days): GLM: 2; GOTM: 1; DYRESM: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Configuration #>     Model controls: Present #>           Physical   |   Biogeochemical #> DY-CD    : Present    |   Present #> GLM-AED  : Present    |   Present #> GOTM-WET : Present    |   Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Observations #> Lake: Present; Level: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Input #> Inital profile: Present; Inital depth: 13.07m; Hypsograph: Present (n=44); #> Meteo: Present; Use longwave: TRUE; Kw: 1.31 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Inflows #> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Outflows #> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Water balance #> Method: 2; Use: obs; Modelled: Absent; Water balance: Present #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Parameters:  #> Number of parameters: 0 #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Output:  #> Number of ensembles: 1 #> DY-CD:    1 #> GLM-AED:  1 #> GOTM-WET: 1 p1 <- plot_output(aeme = aeme, model = model, var_sim = "HYD_temp") p1 p2 <- plot_output(aeme = aeme, model = model, var_sim = "LKE_lvlwtr",                   facet = FALSE) p2

title: Aeme Class — Aeme
text: lake list representing lake information. name: character; lake name. id: character; lake identifier. latitude: numeric; lake latitude. longitude: numeric; lake longitude. elevation: numeric; lake elevation. depth: numeric; lake depth. area: numeric; lake area. time list representing time information. start: character; start date. stop: character; end date. timestep: numeric; time step. spin_up: list; spin information model configuration list representing model's configuration. model_controls: dataframe; Model controls simulation. dy_cd: list; DYRESM-CAEDYM configuration. glm_aed: list; GLM-AED configuration. gotm_wet: list; GOTM-WET configuration. observations list representing observation information. lake: dataframe; lake observations. level: dataframe; lake level observations. input list representing input information. init_profile: dataframe; initial temperature profile (none use NULL leave empty; empty/NULL, observations file used). init_depth: numeric; initial height lake surface relative bottom (m). hypsograph: dataframe; hypsograph. meteo: dataframe; meteorological data. use_lw: logical; use longwave radiation. Kw: numeric; light extinction coefficient (m-1). inflows list representing inflows information. data: named list inflow dataframes. factor: named list; inflow factors model. outflows list representing outflows information. data: named list outflow dataframes. factor: named list; outflow factors model. lvl: numeric; height lake level outflow. water_balance list representing water balance information. method: integer; Method calculating water balance. 1 = none, 2 = outflows, 3 = inflows outflows. use: character; Can 'obs' 'mod'. Use observations  modelled data water balance. data: list dataframe water balance. output list representing output information. dy_cd: list; DYRESM-CAEDYM output. glm_aed: list; GLM-AED output. gotm_wet: list; GOTM-WET output. parameters dataframe representing model parameters.

title: Build model configuration directories — build_aeme
text: aeme aeme; object. config list; loaded via `config <- yaml::read_yaml("aeme.yaml")` model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. model_controls dataframe; configuration loaded "model_controls.csv". inf_factor vector; containing numeric factor multiple inflows. Needs named according model. outf_factor vector; containing numeric factor multiple outflows. Needs named according model. ext_elev numeric; metres extend hypograph . use_bgc logical; switch use biogeochemical model. print logical; print messages. Default = TRUE. calc_wbal logical; calculate water balance. Default = TRUE. wb_method numeric; method use calculating water balance. Must 1 (inflows outflows) 2 (outflows calculated) 3 (inflows outflows calculated). Default = 2 calc_wlev logical; calculate water level. use_aeme logical; use AEME object generate model confiuration files. coeffs numeric vector length two; used estimate surface water temperature estimating evaporation. Defaults NULL. water temperature observations included `aeme` object, use build linear relationship air temperature water temperature. Otherwise. uses simple estimation  \(temp_water = 5 + 0.75 * temp_air\) Stefan & Preud'homme, 2007:  www.doi.org/10.1111/j.1752-1688.1993.tb01502.x hum_type numeric; GOTM humidity metric [1=relative humidity ( 2=wet-bulb temperature, 3=dew point temperature, 4=specific humidity (kg/kg)] Default = 3. est_swr_hr logical; estimate hourly shortwave radiation daily values. Default = TRUE. path filepath; input files located relative `config`.

title: View AEME variables — lookup_aeme_vars
text: group character string filter variables group. Default NULL. Options include "HYD" (hydrodynamic), "LKE" (Lake), "RAD" (Radiation), "CHM" (Chemistry), "PHS" (Phosphorus), "NIT" (Nitrogen), "CAR" (Carbon),  "SIL" (Silica), "MET" (Meteorologica), "ZOO" (Zooplankton),  "PHY" (Phytoplankton), "MAC" (Macrophytes), "NCS" (Non-conservative substances). var_aeme character vector exact AEME variable names filter (e.g., "HYD_temp", "CHM_oxy", "PHS_tp"). Default NULL. name character string filter variables partial match either variable name descriptive text. Default NULL.

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   tmpdir <- tempdir()   aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME")   # Copy files from package into tempdir   file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE)   path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake")   aeme <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml")   model_controls <- get_model_controls()   inf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1)   outf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1)   #'   model <- c("glm_aed", "gotm_wet")   build_aeme(path = path, aeme = aeme, model = model,                  model_controls = model_controls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                  use_bgc = TRUE)   run_aeme(aeme = aeme, model = model, verbose = FALSE, path = path,            parallel = TRUE)    aeme <- load_output(model = model, aeme = aeme, path = path,                            model_controls = model_controls, parallel = TRUE)    p1 <- plot_output(aeme = aeme, model = model,                     var_sim = "HYD_temp", level = TRUE,                     print_plots = FALSE, var_lims = c(0, 30),                     ylim = c(0, 16))   p1[[1]]    p2 <- plot_output(aeme = aeme, model = model,                     var_sim = "LKE_evpvol", print_plots = TRUE,                     ylim = c(0, 0.02)) } # }

code: run_aeme(   aeme,   model,   return = TRUE,   ens_n = 1,   model_controls = NULL,   nlev = NULL,   verbose = FALSE,   debug = FALSE,   timeout = 0,   parallel = FALSE,   ncores,   check_output = FALSE,   path = "." )

title: Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
text: aeme aeme; object. model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. return logical; return model output within `aeme` object? Defaults TRUE. ens_n numeric; ensemble number allocate model output loaded. Defaults 1. model_controls dataframe; configuration loaded "model_controls.csv". nlev numeric; number levels return model output. NULL, calculates number levels based `model_layer_structure`. verbose logical; print model output console. Defaults FALSE. debug logical; write debug log (DYRESM). Defaults FALSE. timeout timeout seconds, ignored 0.  limit     elapsed time running command separate process.   Fractions     seconds ignored. parallel logical; run models parallel. Defaults FALSE. ncores integer; number cores use parallelization. Defaults `min(c(detectCores() - 1, length(model)))`. check_output logical; check model output running? Defaults FALSE. path filepath; input files located relative `config`.

title: Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") yaml <- yaml::read_yaml(file.path(path, "aeme.yaml"))  # Set inflows and outflows to NULL yaml$inflows$data <- NULL yaml$outflows$data <- NULL  write_yaml(yaml, file.path(path, "aeme_simple.yaml")) } # }
